text: Scammers have cost unsuspecting tenants over $2.7M in 2024 through rental scams. Protect yourself when renting or buying properties.Ensure your realtor is CEA-registered and legit!Read on for quick tips to verify.5 Ways to Identify Legit CEA-Registered Realtors:1. Check the CEA Public Register: Visit CEA’s website to verify the realtor’s name or registration number.2. Request a CEA Card: A licensed realtor will have an official CEA-issued identification card.3. Cross-Check Contact Info: Match their contact details with their agency’s website or listings.4. Look for an Agency License: Ensure their real estate agency is also registered with CEA.5. Beware of Red Flags: Avoid anyone demanding upfront payments via unofficial channels or unwilling to show CEA credentials.Stay informed and safe—feel free to reach out to your trusted realtors or me for guidance!
